newsitem.title: USA: Microsoft, U S West invest in Internet video firm.
newsitem.headline: Microsoft, U S West invest in Internet video firm.

text.p: Microsoft Corp. and U S West Interactive Services said they had acquired stakes in VDOnet Corp., the developer of technology that eliminates some of the major hurdles now constraining Internet communications.
The VDOnet software automatically adjusts communications travelling over the Internet to take account of the variety of transmission speeds and capacities found within data networks.

Microsoft said it agreed to license VDOnet technology to enhance its own software for delivering video communications over the Internet. In a statement, Microsoft described the deal as "a major milestone for Internet communication."
U S West Interactive is an Internet-related business unit of U S West Media Group, the holding group for a variety of operations outside its core local telephone business.
Financial terms of the deals were not disclosed.
VDOnet's technology, known as VDOWave, makes computer applications such as video conferencing and video broadcasting possible.
In a separate statement, U S West Interactive said it planned to use VDOnet technology in high-speed Internet communications services it plans to offer using cable modem and other technologies.

U S West said its participation in the investment is part of its strategy to become the third-largest cable company in the United States, which will occur when its parent company, U S West Media Group, completes its merger with Continental Cablevision Inc.
